item.title: My 2019 Book List
item.description: Books I read in 2019. Rich Dad Poor DadWhat the Rich Teach Their Kids About Money - That the Poor and Middle Class Do Not! By: Robert T. Kiyosaki Liar’s PokerRising Through the Wreckage on Wall Street By: Michael Lewis The Ideal Team PlayerHow to Recognize and Cultivate the Three Essential Virtues: A Leadership Fable By: Patrick M. Lencioni The Undoing ProjectA Friendship That Changed Our Minds By: Michael Lewis Atomic HabitsAn Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones By: James Clear The 3-Day EffectBy: Florence Williams The Algebra of HappinessNotes on the Pursuit of Success, Love, and Meaning By: Scott Galloway Radical CandorBe a Kick-Ass Boss Without Losing Your Humanity By: Kim Scott The Manager’s PathA Guide for Tech Leaders Navigating Growth and Change By: Camille Fournier The ONE ThingThe Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results By: Gary Keller, Jay Papasan Accelerate: Building and Scaling High Performing Technology OrganizationsBy: Nicole Forsgren PhD, Jez Humble, Gene Kim FactfulnessTen Reasons We’re Wrong About the World - and Why Things Are Better Than You Think By: Hans Rosling, Anna Rosling Rönnlund, Ola Rosling Emotional Intelligence 2.

item.title: My 2018 Book List
item.description: Books I read in 2018. But What If We’re Wrong?Thinking About the Present as If It Were the Past By: Chuck Klosterman The Chaos ImperativeHow Chance and Disruption Increase Innovation, Effectiveness, and Success By: Ori Brafman, Judah Pollack Measure What MattersHow Google, Bono, and the Gates Foundation Rock the World with OKRs By: John Doerr, Larry Page - foreword The UpstartsHow Uber, Airbnb, and the Killer Companies of the New Silicon Valley Are Changing the World By: Brad Stone It Doesn’t Have to Be Crazy at WorkBy: Jason Fried, David Heinemeier Hansson QuietThe Power of Introverts in a World That Can’t Stop Talking By: Susan Cain Creativity, Inc.

item.title: My 2017 Book List
item.description: Books I read in 2017. Never Split the DifferenceNegotiating as if Your Life Depended on It By: Chris Voss Man’s Search for MeaningBy: Viktor E. Frankl Start with WhyHow Great Leaders Inspire Everyone to Take Action By: Simon Sinek Leaders Eat LastWhy Some Teams Pull Together and Others Don’t By: Simon Sinek Who Moved My Cheese?An Amazing Way to Deal with Change in Your Work and in Your Life By: Spencer Johnson Lead and DisruptHow to Solve the Innovator’s Dilemma By: Charles A.

item.title: My 2016 Book List
item.description: Books I read in 2016. The Phoenix ProjectA Novel About IT, DevOps, and Helping Your Business Win By: Gene Kim , Kevin Behr , George Spafford The Like SwitchAn Ex-FBI Agent’s Guide to Influencing, Attracting, and Winning People Over By: Jack Schafer , Marvin Karlins Team of TeamsNew Rules of Engagement for a Complex World By: General Stanley McChrystal , Tantum Collins , David Silverman , Chris Fussell The Essential Guide for Hiring & Getting HiredPerformance-based Hiring Series By: Lou Adler How to Win Friends & Influence PeopleBy: Dale Carnegie PresenceBringing Your Boldest Self to Your Biggest Challenges By: Amy Cuddy Site Reliability EngineeringHow Google Runs Production Systems By: Betsy Beyer,‎ Chris Jones,‎ Jennifer Petoff,‎ Niall Richard Murphy
